overview_of_class:
Students will learn the fundamentals of independent/low-budget film producing, from pre-production through final delivery. Emphasis will be placed on both applied research and hands-on practice through serving as producer on a student short film in pre-production or production during the quarter. You will be required to deliver an end-of-quarter pitch presentation supplying a detailed schedule and budget for the short film to which you are attached as producer.

Evaluation Method

Attendance/discussion participation, one short essay, one scheduling exercise and one final pitch presentation which includes a full shooting schedule and budget.

Registration Requirements

RTVF 190

Class Materials (Required)

· Irving, David K and Peter Rea. Producing and Directing the Short Film (5th Edition) Focal Press, 2015. ISBN-13: 978-0415732550

· Vachon, Christine, with David Edelstein. Shooting to Kill. Harper, 1998. ISBN-13: 978-0380798544
